com.rolledback.units

Class Unit

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rolledback.units.Unit
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Infantry, RPGTeam, Tank, TankDestroyer

    public class Unit
extends java.lang.Object
    Super class for all units. Contains all functions nescesarry for a unit to interact with the world/game.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Matthew Rayermann (rolledback, www.github.com/rolledback, www.cs.utexas.edu/~mrayer)

      • Unit

        public Unit(int x,
    int y,
    Tile t,
    com.rolledback.teams.Team o)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        x - starting x position of the unit.
        y - starting y position of the unit.
        t - tile that the unit is to be placed on.
        o - team that the unit belongs to.

    • Method Detail

      • calcMoveSpots

        public void calcMoveSpots(boolean atkOnly)
        Sets up the necessary parameters and other actions that need to be done before calling a separate private helper function, calcMoveSpots helper. Although this function is void, upon it's completion the unit's moveSet, captureSet, and attackSet will contain coordinates that the unit can move/capture/attack on.
        Parameters:
        atkOnly - whether or not the helper function should only examine the tiles adjacent to the unit for enemy units. In simpler terms, true when a unit has moved but not yet attacked.

      • canTraverse

        public boolean canTraverse(Tile tile)
        Determines if the unit can traverse the given tile.
        Parameters:
        tile - tile to be tested against.
        Returns:
        whether or not the unit can traverse the tile.

      • canCapture

        public boolean canCapture(Tile tile)
        Determines if the unit can capture the given tile.
        Parameters:
        tile - tile to be tested against.
        Returns:
        whether or not the unit can capture the tile.

      • move

        public void move(Tile tile)
        Moves the unit from its current tile to the provided tile. First determines if the move results in a change of image direction. Then sets the current tile to no longer be occupied. And then finally changes the unit's coordinates, and sets the new tile as occupied and sets its occupiedBy pointer to point to this unit.
        Parameters:
        tile - tile that the unit is being moved to.

      • attack

        public void attack(Unit target,
          boolean isRetaliation)
        Does all the calculations needed for this unit to attack a target.
        Parameters:
        target - unit that this unit is attacking.
        isRetaliation - whether or not the attack is in retaliation to another attack.

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage(int amount)
        Given an amount of damage to take, calculates the amount of actual damage to be taken by the unit.
        Parameters:
        amount - amount of damage done by whoever is attacking this unit.
